name: Velvet
author: Daniel Zerbino[1] , Ewan Birney
description: Velvet is an algorithm package that has been designed to deal with de novo genome assembly and short read sequencing alignments.

commands.name: velveth
commands.description: construct the dataset for the following program, velvetg, and indicate to the system what each sequence file represents.

parameters.name: output_directory
parameters.description: Directory where will be output files

parameters.name: strand_specific
parameters.description: Strand specific sequencing

parameters.name: m,M,s
parameters.description: Multiple k-mers: m â‰¤ k < M with a step of s

parameters.name: noHash
parameters.description: Preprocessing the Sequences file

parameters.name: reuse_Sequences
parameters.description: Preprocessing the Sequences file

parameters.name: create_binary
parameters.description: Using the binary version of Sequences

parameters.name: hash_length
parameters.description: Also known as k-mer length, corresponds to the length, in base pairs, of the words being hashed

parameters.name: file_format
parameters.description: Allows you to write as many filenames as you wish without having to re-type identical descriptors

parameters.name: read_type
parameters.description: Read type

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of file to analyse

commands.name: velvetg
commands.description: Build the Brujin graph and then manipulate it.

parameters.name: output_directory
parameters.description: Directory where will be output files

parameters.name: -cov_cutoff
parameters.description: removal of low coverage nodes AFTER tour bus or allow the system to infer it (default: no removal)

parameters.name: -min_contig_lgth
parameters.description: minimum contig length exported to contigs.fa file (default: hash length * 2)

parameters.name: -max_coverage
parameters.description: removal of high coverage nodes AFTER tour bus (default: no removal)

parameters.name: -exp_cov
parameters.description: expected coverage of unique regions or allow the system to infer it (default: no long or paired-end read resolution)

parameters.name: -ins_length
parameters.description: expected distance between two paired-end reads in the respective short-read dataset (default: no read pairing)

parameters.name: -shortMatePaired
parameters.description: for mate-pair libraries, indicate that the library might be contaminated with paired-end reads (default no)

parameters.name: -ins_length_long
parameters.description: expected distance between two long paired-end reads (default: no read pairing)

parameters.name: -scaffolding
parameters.description: scaffolding of contigs used paired end information (default: on)

parameters.name: -ins_length_long_sd
parameters.description: est. standard deviation of respective dataset (default: 10% of corresponding length)

parameters.name: -ins_length_sd
parameters.description: est. standard deviation of respective dataset (default: 10% of corresponding length)

parameters.name: -ins_length2_sd
parameters.description: est. standard deviation of respective dataset (default: 10% of corresponding length)

parameters.name: -ins_length2
parameters.description: expected distance between two paired-end reads in the respective short-read dataset (default: no read pairing)

parameters.name: -read_trkg
parameters.description: tracking of short read positions in assembly (default: no tracking)

parameters.name: -amos_file
parameters.description: export assembly to AMOS file (default: no export)

parameters.name: -amos_file
parameters.description: export assembly to AMOS file (default: no export)

parameters.name: -unused_reads
parameters.description: export unused reads in UnusedReads.fa file (default: no)

parameters.name: -max_branch_length
parameters.description: maximum length in base pair of bubble (default: 100)

parameters.name: -max_divergence
parameters.description: maximum divergence rate between two branches in a bubble (default: 0.2)

parameters.name: -max_gap_count
parameters.description: maximum number of gaps allowed in the alignment of the two branches of a bubble (default: 3)

parameters.name: -min_pair_count
parameters.description: minimum number of paired end connections to justify the scaffolding of two long contigs (default: 5)

parameters.name: -long_cov_cutoff
parameters.description: removal of nodes with low long-read coverage AFTER tour bus(default: no removal)

parameters.name: -coverage_mask
parameters.description: minimum coverage required for confident regions of contigs (default: 1)

parameters.name: -long_mult_cutoff
parameters.description: minimum number of long reads required to merge contigs (default: 2)

parameters.name: -alignments
parameters.description: export a summary of contig alignment to the reference sequences (default: no)

parameters.name: -exportFiltered
parameters.description: export the long nodes which were eliminated by the coverage filters (default: no)

parameters.name: -clean
parameters.description: remove all the intermediary files which are useless for recalculation (default : no)

parameters.name: -very_clean
parameters.description: remove all the intermediary files (no recalculation possible) (default: no)

parameters.name: -paired_exp_fraction
parameters.description: remove all the paired end connections which less than the specified fraction of the expected count (default: 0.1)

parameters.name: -conserveLong
parameters.description: preserve sequences with long reads in them (default no)
